info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 2:59AM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Henderson County, and mountain portions of Rutherford and Polk Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
